channel.title: NPR Topics: News
channel.description: NPR news, audio, and podcasts. Coverage of breaking stories, national and world news, politics, business, science, technology, and extended coverage of major national and world events.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2024 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: U.S. and Russia discuss ending Ukraine war, without Kyiv
item.description: The talks build on last week's phone call between President Trump and Russian leader Vladimir Putin during which the two leaders agreed to work together towards a negotiated end to the war.
item.content:encoded:
The talks build on last week's phone call between President Trump and Russian leader Vladimir Putin during which the two leaders agreed to work together towards a negotiated end to the war.

(Image credit: Evelyn Hockstein/AP)
item.dc:creator: Charles Maynes

item.title: NYC mayor could be removed from office. And, concerns over peace talks for Ukraine
item.description: New York Gov. Kathy Hochul signaled she may use her authority to remove New York City Mayor Eric Adams from office. And, high-stakes negotiations to end the war in Ukraine begin today.
item.content:encoded:
New York Gov. Kathy Hochul signaled she may use her authority to remove New York City Mayor Eric Adams from office. And, high-stakes negotiations to end the war in Ukraine begin today.

(Image credit: New York Daily News/TNS)
item.dc:creator: Brittney Melton

item.title: Ukraine Talks, U.S. Health Agency Cuts, NYC Mayor Eric Adams Fallout
item.description:
American and Russian officials meet in Saudi Arabia for talks on negotiating an end to the war in Ukraine. The Trump administration has started making broad cuts to federal health agencies. Days after the Justice Department moved to drop corruption charges against New York City Mayor Eric Adams, four of his top aides and deputy mayors announced their resignations.
Want more comprehensive analysis of the most important news of the day, plus a little fun? Subscribe to the Up First newsletter.

Today's episode of Up First was edited by Ryland Barton, Jane Greenhalgh, Denice Rios, Reena Advani and Janaya Williams. It was produced by Ziad Buchh, Nia Dumas and Christopher Thomas. We get engineering support from Arthur Laurent and our technical director is Carleigh Strange. Our Executive Producer is Kelley Dickens.
item.content:encoded:
American and Russian officials meet in Saudi Arabia for talks on negotiating an end to the war in Ukraine. The Trump administration has started making broad cuts to federal health agencies. Days after the Justice Department moved to drop corruption charges against New York City Mayor Eric Adams, four of his top aides and deputy mayors announced their resignations.
Want more comprehensive analysis of the most important news of the day, plus a little fun? Subscribe to the Up First newsletter.

Today's episode of Up First was edited by Ryland Barton, Jane Greenhalgh, Denice Rios, Reena Advani and Janaya Williams. It was produced by Ziad Buchh, Nia Dumas and Christopher Thomas. We get engineering support from Arthur Laurent and our technical director is Carleigh Strange. Our Executive Producer is Kelley Dickens.

item.title: An ancient Roman basilica has been discovered below London's financial district
item.description: The basilica, dating back some 1,900 years, was found during excavations that took place as part of the demolition of a building in the heart of London.
item.content:encoded:
The basilica, dating back some 1,900 years, was found during excavations that took place as part of the demolition of a building in the heart of London.

(Image credit: MOLA)
item.dc:creator: Willem Marx

item.title: As sports betting has soared, more people search online for help with gambling addiction
item.description: A study shows more people are looking for help to manage gambling addiction, in the years after a Supreme Court decision allowed online sports betting in 38 states.
item.content:encoded:
A study shows more people are looking for help to manage gambling addiction, in the years after a Supreme Court decision allowed online sports betting in 38 states.

(Image credit: Aaron M. Sprecher)
item.dc:creator: Katia Riddle

item.title: Human gene variant alters the voices of mice
item.description: A new study shows that giving mice the human version of a gene changes their squeak, suggesting some of the genetic underpinnings of language.
item.content:encoded:
A new study shows that giving mice the human version of a gene changes their squeak, suggesting some of the genetic underpinnings of language.

(Image credit: anyaivanova/Getty Images)
item.dc:creator: Nell Greenfieldboyce

item.title: Can President Trump ignore Congress' spending laws? The debate over 'impoundment'
item.description: Since taking office, the Trump administration and DOGE have been seeking to unilaterally override the spending plans set by Congress. Can they do that under the U.S. Constitution?
item.content:encoded: Since taking office, the Trump administration and DOGE have been seeking to unilaterally override the spending plans set by Congress. Can they do that under the U.S. Constitution?
item.dc:creator: Greg Rosalsky

item.title: Is the Justice Department cutting breaks to people who seem loyal to Trump?
item.description: The department dropped a case against former Rep. Jeff Fortenberry, withdrew from an investigation against Rep. Andy Ogles, and moved to dismiss the case against New York Mayor Eric Adams.
item.content:encoded:
The department dropped a case against former Rep. Jeff Fortenberry, withdrew from an investigation against Rep. Andy Ogles, and moved to dismiss the case against New York Mayor Eric Adams.

(Image credit: Andrew Harnik)
item.dc:creator: Carrie Johnson

item.title: Leonard Peltier to be released from prison following commutation in FBI killings
item.description: Peltier's imprisonment has symbolized systemic injustice for Native Americans across the country who believe in his innocence.
item.content:encoded:
Peltier's imprisonment has symbolized systemic injustice for Native Americans across the country who believe in his innocence.

(Image credit: Joe Ledford)
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press

item.title: Health agencies lose staff members in key areas as Trump firings set in
item.description: As the dust settles from the first wave of firings at health agencies, here's how many people got cut and the impact of the roles that were lost.
item.content:encoded:
As the dust settles from the first wave of firings at health agencies, here's how many people got cut and the impact of the roles that were lost.

(Image credit: Alex Wong)
item.dc:creator: Will Stone
